title: How to Adjust the Filter Strength on Instagram on Android

steps.headline: Open Instagram.
steps.description: It’s the red, orange, and purple camera icon in the app drawer. Depending on your settings, you may also find it on the home screen. If you’re not signed in to Instagram, follow the on-screen instructions to do so now.

steps.headline: Tap the new post button.
steps.description: It’s a plus (+) symbol inside of a square at the bottom of the screen. You can only adjust a filter’s strength when you’re making a new image post.

steps.headline: Select an image and tap Next.
Select a filter.
steps.description: Once you tap a filter, you’ll see a preview of your image with that filter applied.

steps.headline: Tap the filter again.
steps.description: This opens a slider beneath the image. One side of the slider is a 0, the other side is 100.

steps.headline: Move the slider to the desired strength.
steps.description: Move the slider to the left to decrease the filter’s intensity, and right to increase it.

steps.headline: Tap Share.
steps.description: You can enter a caption before you share the image, if you wish. The image will now appear in the feed with the customized filter.

text: Open Instagram. It’s the red, orange, and purple camera icon in the app drawer. Depending on your settings, you may also find it on the home screen. If you’re not signed in to Instagram, follow the on-screen instructions to do so now. Tap the new post button. It’s a plus (+) symbol inside of a square at the bottom of the screen. You can only adjust a filter’s strength when you’re making a new image post. Select an image and tap Next.  Select a filter. Once you tap a filter, you’ll see a preview of your image with that filter applied. Tap the filter again. This opens a slider beneath the image. One side of the slider is a 0, the other side is 100. Move the slider to the desired strength. Move the slider to the left to decrease the filter’s intensity, and right to increase it. Tap Done.  Tap Next.  Tap Share. You can enter a caption before you share the image, if you wish. The image will now appear in the feed with the customized filter.
